question_sentence: Which country announced that it would stop playing loud music at its border following complaints from locals?
evidence: Seoul suspended broadcasts of K-pop and political propaganda into North Korea via loudspeakers "as part of attempts by its new left-wing government to cool tensions" with the hermit kingdom to the north, said The Telegraph. Hours later, Pyongyang announced it would halt its rival broadcasts, ending the noisy propaganda war.

question_sentence: ABC News has suspended a presenter who referred to White House Deputy Chief of Staff Stephen Miller as what?
evidence: ABC News suspended veteran correspondent Terry Moran over a deleted late-night social media post calling Miller a "world-class hater" who is "richly endowed with the capacity for hatred" and whose "hatreds are his spiritual nourishment".

question_sentence: What was the name of the boat that was halted by Israeli authorities while attempting to deliver aid to Gaza?
evidence: The yacht, named after the first known Palestinian fisherwoman, was diverted to the Israeli port city of Ashdod. Ten of the 12 activists on board – including climate campaigner Greta Thunberg and a French MEP – have been deported to their home countries, with the final two expected to follow today.

question_sentence: Why did California governor Gavin Newsom file a lawsuit against Donald Trump?
choices: For deploying the National Guard to LA
For attempting to place California under a curfew
evidence: Donald Trump deployed 4,000 National Guard troops and 700 marines to Los Angeles in response to protests over raids by Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers. Governor Newsom, opposing the deployment, filed a lawsuit to block the National Guard activation and said he would also sue over the marines’ deployment, calling both actions inflammatory abuses of power.

question_sentence: Which team were crowned winners of the UK's first ever "Baller League"?
evidence: In a thrilling final at the O2 in London, SDS FC beat MVPs United 4-3. Inspired by similar leagues in Germany and Spain, Baller League UK blends sport and entertainment, with six-a-side teams playing 30-minute indoor matches with unique rules designed to encourage exciting, viral-friendly gameplay.

question_sentence: Disney and Universal Pictures are suing which AI firm?
evidence: Disney and Universal Pictures sued the image-generation AI platform after accusing the San Francisco start-up of "blatantly" copying characters from their most famous franchises like Star Wars, Marvel and "Frozen".

question_sentence: Who won the coveted "best performance by an actor in a leading role in a play" at Sunday's Tony Awards?
evidence: Escola became the first non-binary performer to win one of theatre's highest accolades, for their Broadway debut playing Mary Todd Lincoln in "Oh, Mary!". Sarah Snook took the corresponding "best performance by an actress in a leading role in a play" for her one-woman version of "The Picture of Dorian Gray".

question_sentence: A rare Labubu figurine was recently sold at an auction in Beijing for how much?
evidence: A 131cm first-generation Labubu figure sold for 1.08 million yuan ($150,000) at an auction in Beijing. The event, seen as the "world's first" auction of first-generation collectible Labubus, featured a total of 48 figures.

question_sentence: Many Iranian cities have announced bans on doing what in public?
evidence: At least 18 cities issued directives echoing an existing – although much-flouted – ban on dog walking already active in the capital, Tehran. Dog ownership has become popular among young Iranians, but it conflicts with conservative religious and cultural taboos, which view dogs as ritually unclean and not suitable as companion animals.

question_sentence: Scientists have developed a plastic that dissolves in what?
evidence: Japanese scientists have developed a plastic that dissolves in seawater within hours as a potential solution to ocean pollution. The material breaks down quickly, leaving no residual trace, according to researchers from the Riken Center for Emergent Matter Science and the University of Tokyo.

question_sentence: President Donald Trump recently ordered the deployment of thousands of National Guard troops to which city?
evidence: Trump ordered the deployment to quell immigration crackdown protests in Los Angeles, overriding the objections of California Gov. Gavin Newsom and local officials. Similar protests have since spread across the US.

question_sentence: An Air India passenger plane carrying 242 people crashed on Thursday shortly after takeoff en route to which city?
evidence: The Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner was headed to London’s Gatwick Airport when it crashed in India’s western city of Ahmedabad.

question_sentence: A senator running to join next year’s presidential race was nearly assassinated recently in which country?
evidence: Colombian senator Miguel Uribe Turbay, 39, was shot twice during a campaign event in Bogota.

question_sentence: Which best-selling author, whose books sold 75 million copies, died this week?
evidence: Frederick Forsyth, the British author of “The Day of the Jackal” and other thrillers, died at age 86 after a brief illness.

question_sentence: Which popular TikTok personality left the US this week after being detained by immigration agents in Las Vegas?
evidence: Senegalese-Italian Influencer Khaby Lame, who has over 162 million followers on TikTok, was detained for allegedly overstaying his visa, but was allowed to leave the country without a deportation order.

question_sentence: Who took home her first Tony for best performance by a lead actress in a play?
evidence: Snook won her first Tony for portraying 26 characters in “The Picture of Dorian Gray.” Scherzinger won her first Tony for best performance by a lead actress in a musical for “Sunset Blvd.”

question_sentence: The annual “Dirty Dozen” list features the 12 nonorganic fruits and vegetables that are the most contaminated by pesticides. Which fruit is not on the list?
evidence: Pineapples took the top spot of the “Clean Fifteen,” a separate list of conventional produce with the least amount of pesticide residue.

question_sentence: A DoorDash delivery driver recently got lost in Chicago and accidentally ended up where?
choices: Inside a hot dog processing plant
evidence: The driver, who mistakenly drove past a gate at O’Hare and headed into a restricted area, ended up parked next to a grounded plane.

question_sentence: Dresses, hats, handbags and shoes belonging to which fashion icon will be up for auction later this month?
evidence: Princess Diana’s ski suit, a Dior handbag and the floral dress she wore to visit children in the hospital are among dozens of items headed to auction.

question_sentence: Chipotle is launching a new dip next week in which flavor?
evidence: The new dip combines classic ranch with adobo pepper. It’s the first time Chipotle has added a new dip in five years.
